intro: Trianaeopiper cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cauca pipevine, is a rare and strikingly beautiful plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae, which is known for its unique and often complex floral structures. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and a distinctive, hooded flower that resembles a pipe, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the high-altitude ecosystems of the Andes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
